result.execSummary:
The defendant Peter Cabrera was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: -Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan.

-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Peter Cabrera

records.addlTxt:
4:20 PM Defendant Peter Cabrera appeared by video.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for Peter Cabrera. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to the charge with a fine, costs and DNA sample. Defendant has no objection to appearing via zoom. Court goes over right to appear in person with his attorney. 

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant. Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights. Court goes over the elements of each offense. Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty. Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST. Court finds the plea is made knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently. Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea. Court finds the defendant guilty as charged. Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today. Sentencing statement by DA. Sentencing statement by Atty Kapelis. No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

-$250 fine plus costs. Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or call the Clerk of Courts Office (920-294-4142) to set-up a payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample. 

Court adjourned at 4:29 PM
Letter to the Court from Atty Kapelis dated May 6, 2022 re: req for def to appear via zoom          (NOTE: 05/09 approved by the Court)
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 10, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Pretrial Status Report
Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Rhonda in Dispatch.
Warrant has been cancelled - talked with Rhonda in Dispatch.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Sent to GLSO on March 8, 2022

Defendant has failed to follow the Court Order to sign the bond within 2 weeks of the 02/08/2022 Initial Appearance court date, with an extension granted to 03/04/2022. Upon completion the defendant may be released.

Def called in reference to signing his bond. Def stated he had a difficult time getting here to get it signed as he was not from the area. Def stated he has been in contact with his attorney. I informed the def I sent his attorney his bond yesterday morning so he has the option of signing the bond through his attorney as well as through us as the Clerk of Court's office. Def stated he had no way of getting the bond from his attorney. Def then asked if we received the letter from his attorney requesting an extension. I informed him that the letter was received but Judge has not seen it yet and we're waiting to see if the extension is approved or denied. Def stated he understood. I informed the def if he could not get here to sign the bond that he needed to contact his attorney and figure out how to get his bond signed and submitted as soon as possible.
Letter to Judge Slate from Atty Kapelis dated 02/23/2022 re: request extension to sign & return the bond         (NOTE: 02/24 - Per Judge, allows extension)
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**
Return date on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

9:48 AM Defendant Peter Cabrera appeared by video, Attorney Michael J Kapelis appeared in court for Peter Cabrera, Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. Def has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and enters NOT GUILTY plea on behalf of the def. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500 signature bond and conditions of: Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court gives defendant 2 weeks to sign bond and complete processing or a warrant will be issued.  Court will set for Return Date on May 2, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 9:50 AM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Atty Michael Kapelis

Def called requesting to appear via zoom at his Feb 08 court date due to living in Wausau and not having a ride. Def was told his next court was an Initial Appearance and we required those to be in person so his bond could be signed and processing completed. Def was told if he wanted to appear via zoom, he needed to submit something in writing. Def was given our address so he could write a letter. Def's phone number and address were updated. Def was given the number to the public defender's office.

ADDRESS INFO for Peter Cabrera
Current: 1016 S 6th Ave, Wausau, WI 54401 United States  (Effective: 01-27-2022)
Prior: 246 N Washington St Apt 202, Berlin, WI 54923
